body:
Thanks for filing this. I wanted to ask a couple of questions. 

1. Are you executing this as `mflow run .  -e main -P arg=<value>` as a root
2. When do you say in the docker file you are switching the user, how are you switching the user?
3. Can you try running the mlflow server as a non-root user?

cc: asking @smurching for any insight into it.

Thank you for your quick answer.




>     1. Are you executing this as `mflow run .  -e main -P arg=<value>` as a root
No.

>     2. When do you say in the docker file you are switching the user, how are you switching the user?
USER user
>     3. Can you try running the mlflow server as a non-root user?
Makes no difference.

The issue was confirmed by someone in the Slack channel.

Hello @Zethson, again thanks for answering the question quickly.

_Any Docker example should suffice._ 
I tried to run our examples/docker to see the results. 

 ```
docker images
REPOSITORY              TAG                 IMAGE ID            CREATED              SIZE
docker-example          e5eb78f             2fca45ad43a6        About a minute ago   1.08GB
mlflow-docker-example   latest              2c86e6ffd905        5 minutes ago        1.08GB
```
```
mlflow run examples/docker -P alpha=0.5
2020/05/27 09:10:23 INFO mlflow.projects: === Building docker image docker-example:e5eb78f ===
2020/05/27 09:10:24 INFO mlflow.projects: === Created directory /var/folders/jz/qg062ynx5v39wwmfxmph5nn40000gp/T/tmpo32eldbz for downloading remote URIs passed to arguments of type 'path' ===
2020/05/27 09:10:24 INFO mlflow.projects: === Running command 'docker run --rm -v /Users/julesdamji/gits/mlflow/mlruns:/mlflow/tmp/mlruns -v /Users/julesdamji/gits/mlflow/mlruns/0/82165e5cfeb74c238c980552480dcba1/artifacts:/Users/julesdamji/gits/mlflow/mlruns/0/82165e5cfeb74c238c980552480dcba1/artifacts -e MLFLOW_RUN_ID=82165e5cfeb74c238c980552480dcba1 -e MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=file:///mlflow/tmp/mlruns -e MLFLOW_EXPERIMENT_ID=0 docker-example:e5eb78f python train.py --alpha 0.5 --l1-ratio 0.1' in run with ID '82165e5cfeb74c238c980552480dcba1' ===
/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mlflow/__init__.py:55: DeprecationWarning: MLflow support for Python 2 is deprecated and will be dropped in a future release. At that point, existing Python 2 workflows that use MLflow will continue to work without modification, but Python 2 users will no longer get access to the latest MLflow features and bugfixes. We recommend that you upgrade to Python 3 - see https://docs.python.org/3/howto/pyporting.html for a migration guide.
  "for a migration guide.", DeprecationWarning)
Elasticnet model (alpha=0.500000, l1_ratio=0.100000):
  RMSE: 0.794793101903653
  MAE: 0.6189130834228139
  R2: 0.18411668718221808
2020/05/27 09:10:31 INFO mlflow.projects: === Run (ID '82165e5cfeb74c238c980552480dcba1') succeeded ===
```
All the files created under mlruns are owned not by root but by me.

```
ls -l mlruns/0/82165e5cfeb74c238c980552480dcba1
total 8
drwxr-xr-x   3 julesdamji  staff   96 May 27 09:10 artifacts
-rw-r--r--   1 julesdamji  staff  399 May 27 09:10 meta.yaml
drwxr-xr-x   5 julesdamji  staff  160 May 27 09:10 metrics
drwxr-xr-x   4 julesdamji  staff  128 May 27 09:10 params
drwxr-xr-x  14 julesdamji  staff  448 May 27 09:10 tags
```
 _I can share my custom code if you need it, but it's getting complex now._

I would be curious how you ran this and all the steps from building the docker image, to running with mlflow. I guess you referring to this conversation on the [slack channel](https://mlflow-users.slack.com/archives/CBFQ95Y2G/p1590515743310600?thread_ts=1590514306.309500&cid=CBFQ95Y2G)

Dear @dmatrix,

thanks! I guess the misunderstanding is that we are talking about the files inside the docker container!
To me it looks like you were looking at the permissions of the mounted files on your very own filesystem.

So to reproduce it with the mlflow docker example:
`
mlflow run examples/docker -P alpha=0.5`

You will then see how it ran Docker, e.g.:
`docker run --rm -v /home/zeth/PycharmProjects/mlflow/examples/docker/mlruns:/mlflow/tmp/mlruns -v /home/zeth/PycharmProjects/mlflow/examples/docker/mlruns/0/f3ebf070053643ab9171c4834424c9c1/artifacts:/home/zeth/PycharmProjects/mlflow/examples/docker/mlruns/0/f3ebf070053643ab9171c4834424c9c1/artifacts -e MLFLOW_RUN_ID=f3ebf070053643ab9171c4834424c9c1 -e MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=file:///mlflow/tmp/mlruns -e MLFLOW_EXPERIMENT_ID=0 docker-example:142abbb python train.py --alpha 0.5 --l1-ratio 0.1`

After mlflow is done you can start the Docker container in interactive mode with a shell:
`docker run --rm -it -v /home/zeth/PycharmProjects/mlflow/examples/docker/mlruns:/mlflow/tmp/mlruns -v /home/zeth/PycharmProjects/mlflow/examples/docker/mlruns/0/f3ebf070053643ab9171c4834424c9c1/artifacts:/home/zeth/PycharmProjects/mlflow/examples/docker/mlruns/0/f3ebf070053643ab9171c4834424c9c1/artifacts -e MLFLOW_RUN_ID=f3ebf070053643ab9171c4834424c9c1 -e MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=file:///mlflow/tmp/mlruns -e MLFLOW_EXPERIMENT_ID=0 docker-example:142abbb /bin/bash` 
(I added -it and replaced the run command with /bin/bash).
If you now navigate through the file system to the artifacts etc everything will be owned by root.

I was trying to use Docker container environment during mlflow run (https://github.com/HiromuHota/fonduer-mlflow/pull/13) last month.
It ran without any problem on Mac (as the Docker host), but did not on Linux. What I found was that the different behavior between Linux and Mac of file system sharing makes this hard to work as expected both on Linux and Mac.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43097341/docker-on-macosx-does-not-translate-file-ownership-correctly-in-volumes

Correct me if I'm wrong, but seems like @Zethson is using Linux (as the Docker host) and @dmatrix is using Mac.
In order to reproduce this issue, the Docker host may need to be Linux.
Nice find @HiromuHota . I am indeed using Linux.

@HiromuHota @Zethson 
That solves a mystery of different behavior under Linux and macOS. I shall raise this with the team. 
Meanwhile, does the suggestion by @HiromuHota in the [slack thread](https://mlflow-users.slack.com/archives/CBFQ95Y2G/p1590515743310600?thread_ts=1590514306.309500&cid=CBFQ95Y2G) mitigate or resolve your issue on Linux?

cc: @smurching @dbczumar
